'''Anke Katrin Eißmann''' (born [[1977]]) is a German artist and teacher. 
==History==
Eißmann was introduced to the world of [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] in [[1991]], after watching [[The Lord of the Rings (1978 film)|the Ralph Bakshi animated film]]. She studied Visual Communication at the [[Wikipedia:Bauhaus University|Bauhaus University]] in [[Wikipedia:Weimar|Weimar]] and Art & Design at [[wikipedia:Colchester Institute|Colchester Institute]].<ref name=about >[http://anke.edoras-art.de/anke_about.html about Anke] at anke.edoras-art.de (accessed 29 May 2023)</ref> Her work had been popular on the Internet for some time when she was asked to attend [[Tolkien 2005]],<ref>[https://web.archive.org/web/20100314221855/http://www.tolkien-buecher.de/en/anke-eissmann.html Interview with Anke Eißmann from November 2009], available at the ''Internet Archive'' (accessed 29 May 2023)</ref> filling an artists' panel with [[Alan Lee]] and [[Ted Nasmith]]. That same year, her art was used in ''[[Ringers: Lord of the Fans]]''. She has since sat on the artists' panel at [[The Return of the Ring]] and [[Tolkien 2019]].<ref>[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XwczPh9pUM4&ab_channel=TheTolkienSociety Illustrating Tolkien Panel] on [[The Tolkien Society]]'s YouTube channel</ref> Currently, she works as an art teacher for Gymnasien (german secondary schools)<ref name=about /> and is on the editorial team of ''Der Flammifer von Westernis'', the [[German Tolkien Society]]'s bi-yearly magazine.<ref>[https://www.tolkiengesellschaft.de/der-verein/vereinspublikationen/flammifer-von-westernis/ Der Flammifer von Westernis] on TolkienGesellschaft.de (accessed 20 June 2023)</ref>
